The Cut Flower Handbook

by Lisa Mason Ziegler

Learn how to grow an abundance of beautiful cut flowers for pleasure or profit. This handbook includes 41 cool-season and 25 warm-season flowers to grow and harvest.

settings.heading: Select, Plant, Grow, and Harvest Gorgeous Blooms

settings.text:
Lisa’s newest and latest book, The Cut Flower Handbook, is for anyone interested in bringing more beauty into their lives by growing cut flowers.  

The perfect balance of inspiration and education, The Cut Flower Handbook teaches how Lisa grows and harvests annual cut flowers from seed to bloom while sharing the varieties that have become her tried and true favorites. Learn how the size of your growing area alone determines the success or failure of your cutting garden and when to plant cool-season and warm-season flowers.

Lisa shares her streamlined steps for preparing, locating, and maintaining the cutting garden. Learn why and how she selects the best seed starting method for a specific flower and its favored growing conditions. Lisa also shares her tried and true methods for how she starts seeds –  from soil blocking to growing in plug trays to planting seeds directly in the garden!

Over half the book features specific flowers or flower groups, including growing facts, Lisa’s firsthand experiences with them, tips for home gardeners and flower farmers, harvesting and conditioning steps, and lists of Lisa’s favorite varieties.

Lisa’s logical and nature-driven method is the signature hallmark of her super-successful online flower-farming courses, and it’s one that translates equally well to both small urban backyards and large rural flower farms.

The book is an 8” x 10”, 240 page Hardback. Included in this essential cut flower growing handbook are:

45 extensive flower profiles divided into their preferred season of growth. This includes 41 cool-season flowers like poppies, snapdragons, and bells of Ireland plus 25 warm-season beauties like zinnias, sunflowers, and celosia.
Planting tips for a succession of blooms that carry over from one growing season to the next providing flowers from spring to fall.
Illustrations showing succession plantings, how to pinch plants for more blooms, how to make your cuts, how to dig a planting bed, and more.

Over 200 photographs of the best cut flowers to grow, the most effective methods for their care, advice on caring for a cutting garden, locating the best planting site, starting plants from seed, making the harvest, prolonging the life of your cut flowers, and so much more!

settings.content: More people join the gardening renaissance every season, and once they do so, it doesn’t take long for them to discover the joy of growing blooms, both for their own enjoyment and to share with others. The Cut Flower Handbook is Lisa Mason Ziegler’s generous gift to our community of gardeners and backyard growers, filled with practical flower-growing knowledge, encouragement, inspiration, and advice on flower selections for cool and warm seasons. Dive into this extensive handbook and learn from a pro! Your senses and empty vases will soon be overflowing.
settings.title: — Debra Prinzing, author and founder of the Slow Flowers Society
settings.author: shopify://shop_images/debra1.webp

settings.content: Lisa Ziegler’s message is simple: everyone can grow cut flowers. And she has the decades of practical experience to guide you from seed to harvest. The Cut Flower Handbook is essential reading for anyone interested in learning not just how to grow cut flowers, but how to grow them well year after year. The information and advice is clear and aimed at both new and experienced gardeners as well as those with big and small gardens. If you want to grow flowers, you need this book.

settings.content: The Cut Flower Handbook is a must-own for anyone who loves cut flowers. Lisa’s straightforward, step-by-step approach to growing and harvesting annual flowers is easy to understand and apply.
